knimeNode.name: BioConverter
knimeNode.shortDescription: Converts between different kind of plate formats.

intro.p: This allows you to make advantage of different tools. It is bundled with some predefined profiles to make easier the conversion.

You can adjust the different concepts to your needs. In the input part of each concept-tab select the profile you want to use, or select the custom profile, and select the column, the pattern to use, and the type/position of the result column.
You can use regular expressions here. The first group ( , ) will create the result.
You have to use the same type/format for each output with the same name. If not set it will not be generated, in that case you should select the type: Do not generate .

You can select the output result type. Must be one of these:
Integer
Real
String
Do not generate

You can give a constraint on the position of the generated column. For positive values those will be computed from the beginning. The negative ones are computed from the (after all generated) columns.

fullDescription.option: The template profile applied to the input table
The template profile to use on the result columns
If checked it will not remove those columns that are not specified in the input columns.
If checked it will not just add the new columns, but also keep the input columns (those that are not replaced with a new content).
If checked it will generate some kind of result instead of missing values. (Currently does not work really well.)
You may set the experiment name related columns here.
You may set the plate related columns here.
You may set the replicate related columns here.
You may set the row of well (the letter) related columns here.
You may set the column of well (the number) related columns here.
